title: What is a single discount equivalent to two successive discounts of 15% and 20%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! Let the price of item on which the two successive discount of 15% and 20% applicable be 100 First discount of 15% on ₹100 = ₹15 Price after 15% Discount = ₹85 Successive discount of 20% will be applicable on price after 1st discount 20% of ₹85 20/100 × 85 = 85/5 = ₹17 Price of the item after second discount = ₹85 - ₹17 = ₹68 Two successive discounts total = ₹15 + ₹ 17 = ₹32 As the price of the item before calculation was taken as ₹100 therefore the sum of successive discounts of 15% and 20% or single discount is equal to 32% Answer : Two successive discounts of 15% and 20% are equal to single discount of 32%

Let price be 100 First discount @ 15%=15 Discounted price=85 Second discount@ 20%=17 Second discounted price=68 Total of discounts =15+17=32 Successive discounts of 15% and 20% is equal to single discount of 32%
